name: MEMLET
tagline: MEMLET is a Graphical User Interface designed to fit single molecule and other biophysical data using Maximum Likelihood Estimation
body:
#Download MEMLET Now:
###Recommended:
####[Download Everything](https://github.com/michaelswoody/MEMLET/archive/master.zip) - Includes latest version of script files, standalone version, Demo Data, Tutorial and Full Help file  

###Download Components: 
**[Matlab script files only (v0.9.0)](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/23079841/MEMLET.zip)**
 (requires Matlab Installation and License)  
**[Standalone Program (v0.9.0)](https://github.com/michaelswoody/MEMLET/blob/master/Stand-alone%20Installer/Install%20MEMLET.exe)** 
(does not require MATLAB, will prompt for free download of MATLAB Runtime during installation)  
**[Download Documentation and Tutorials with Demo Data](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/23079841/MEMLET_Doc_and_Demo.zip)**

---
Please sign up for updates and bug fixes to MEMLET by sending a blank email to memletinfo@gmail.com (we promise not to spam you in any way, we will only notify you of major updates, and you can unsubscribe at any time

---
![MEMLET Screenshot](https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/23079841/MEMFIT-Screenshot.jpg)
--- 
##Description
MEMLET is an easy to use, MATLAB-based, Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE) fitting tool. It was designed to provide many of the powerful features of MLE to a wide variety of users. It can run either within the MATLAB environment, or is available as a standalone version which can be run on any computer with a free runtime download.  The full features and uses of MEMLET are fully described in its documentation and the accompanying publication, but include: 
-	No need to bin data
-	Significance testing of competing models
-	Correction for dead time/minimum detectable event (MDE)
-	Global Fitting
-	Determination of confidence intervals using bootstrapping 
-	Fits Multidimensional Datasets 
-	Optional Command line interface
